abstract.t: This document specifies additions and amendments to SSH GSS-API Methods. It defines a new key exchange method that uses SHA-2 for integrity and deprecates weak DH groups. The purpose of this specification is to modernize the cryptographic primitives used by GSS Key Exchanges.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: SSH GSS-API Methods allows the use of GSSAPI for authentication and key exchange in SSH. services over a network. It defines three exchange methods all based on DH groups and SHA-1. The new methods described in this document are intended to support environments that desired to use the SHA-2 cryptographic hash functions.

section.title: Document Conventions
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: Except for the use of a different secure hash function, no other significant changes has been made to the protocol described by SSH GSS-API Methods therefore all the original Security Considerations apply.
